meanings.definition: To work hard or toil excessively.
meanings.sent1: After school, he was fagging away on his homework.
meanings.sent2: She was fagging in the garden under the hot sun.
meanings.sent3: The ants were fagging to carry the crumbs to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The old car was fagging up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The determined squirrel kept fagging to crack open the nut.

meanings.definition: A junior student who performs menial tasks for a senior student.
meanings.sent1: The new student became the senior's fagging helper.
meanings.sent2: The fagging was responsible for cleaning the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The fagging accidentally spilled water while mopping.
meanings.sent4: The fagging eagerly ran errands for the senior student.
meanings.sent5: The fagging carried the heavy books for the senior without complaint.

meanings.sent1: He took a quick puff of his fagging before the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She found a pack of fagging in his jacket pocket.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a clue in the discarded fagging.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the smell of fagging smoke.
meanings.sent5: The old man enjoyed his evening fagging on the porch.
